statgraphics.eda
Class CombinedLineBarPlot

java.lang.Object
  statgraphics.GraphicalAnalysis
      statgraphics.eda.CombinedLineBarPlot

public class CombinedLineBarPlot
extends GraphicalAnalysis

Generates a bar plot.


Example:
String[] category = {"2004", "2005", "2006", "2007", "2008"};
String[] lineDataNames = {"Apple", "Compaq", "IBM"};
String[] barDataNames = {"Microsoft", "Google"};
double[][] lineData = { {13, 12, 5, 9, 11}, {12, 13, 6, 8, 11},
    {14, 11, 4, 11, 10} };
double[][] barData = { {17, 17, 10, 14, 11}, {19, 23, 16, 18, 21} };
PlotFrame[] pf = new PlotFrame[4];

// Line plot is upper
pf[0] = new PlotFrame("Combined Line and Bar Plot I",
    new CombinedLineBarPlot(
    lineDataNames, barDataNames,
    "Combined Line (Upper) and Bar Plot (Lower)",
    "Years (2004-2008)",
    "Sales", "Number of Commercials",
    category, lineData, barData).getPlot(),
    500, 270);

// Bar plot is upper
pf[1] = new PlotFrame("Combined Line and Bar Plot II",
    new CombinedLineBarPlot(false,
    lineDataNames, barDataNames,
    "Combined Line (Lower) and Bar Plot (Upper)",
    "Years (2004-2008)",
    "Sales", "Number of Commercials",
    category, lineData, barData).getPlot(),
    500, 270);

// Another way to generate the combined line and bar plot
Hashtable argument1 = new Hashtable();
argument1.put(TITLE, "Combined Line and Bar Plot");
argument1.put(XLABEL, "Years (2004-2008)");
argument1.put(YLABEL, new String[]{"Sales", "Number of Commercials"});
argument1.put(DATA_NAMES, new String[][]{lineDataNames, barDataNames});
pf[2] = new PlotFrame("Combined Line and Bar Plot III",
    new CombinedLineBarPlot(argument1, category,
    lineData, barData).
    graphicalAnalysis.getPlot(), 500, 270);

// Combined line and bar plot for the same data set
argument1.put(YLABEL, new String[]{"Sales", "Sales"});
argument1.put(DATA_NAMES, new String[][]{lineDataNames, lineDataNames});
argument1.put(IS_LINE_PLOT_UPPER, false);
GraphicalAnalysis graphicalAnalysis = new CombinedLineBarPlot(
    argument1, category, lineData, lineData). graphicalAnalysis;
JFreeChart myPlot = (JFreeChart) graphicalAnalysis.output.get("PLOT");
pf[3] = new PlotFrame("Combined Line and Bar Plot IV",
    myPlot, 500, 270);
new PlotFrameFactory().putPlotFrame(pf);

Constructor Detail

CombinedLineBarPlot

public CombinedLineBarPlot()
Default CombinedLineBarPlot constructor.

CombinedLineBarPlot

public CombinedLineBarPlot(java.util.Hashtable argument,
                           java.lang.Object... dataObject)
Creates a new combined line and bar plot given the input arguments and data.

Parameters:
argument - the arguments with the following choices,
IS_LINE_PLOT_UPPER, DATANAMES, TITLE, XLABEL, YLABEL: complete list of arguments;
DATANAMES, TITLE, XLABEL, YLABEL: generating a combined plot of which upper plot is the line plot;
DATANAMES: the default title "Combined Line and Bar Plot", x-label "Category", and y-labels "Value";

dataObject - the input categories the data belong to and data series.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - wrong input argument(s) or data or data type.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the length of the category vector should be equal to the one of the input data series.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the number of data series should be equal to the number of data names.

CombinedLineBarPlot

public CombinedLineBarPlot(boolean isLinePlotUpper,
                           java.lang.String[] linePlotDataNames,
                           java.lang.String[] barPlotDataNames,
                           java.lang.String title,
                           java.lang.String xLabel,
                           java.lang.String linePlotYLabel,
                           java.lang.String barPlotYLabel,
                           java.lang.String[] category,
                           double[][] linePlotData,
                           double[][] barPlotData)
Creates a new combined line and bar plot.

Parameters:
isLinePlotUpper - the boolean indicating whether the upper plot is the line plot.
linePlotDataNames - the names of the data series for the line plot,
dataNames[j]: the name of the (j+1)'th data series.
barPlotDataNames - the names of the data series for the bar plot,
dataNames[j]: the name of the (j+1)'th data series.
title - the plot title.
xLabel - the label for the x-axis.
linePlotYLabel - the label for the y-axis of the line plot.
barPlotYLabel - the label for the y-axis of the bar plot.
category - the categories the data belong to,
category[j]: the (j+1)'th category.
linePlotData - the data series for the line plot,
data[j]: the (j+1)'th data series.
barPlotData - the data series for the bar plot,
data[j]: the (j+1)'th data series.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the length of the category vector should be equal to the one of the input data series.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the number of data series should be equal to the number of data names.

linePlotYLabel - the label for the y-axis of the line plot.

category[j]: the (j+1)'th category.

data[j]: the (j+1)'th data series.
barPlotData - the data series for the bar plot,
data[j]: the (j+1)'th data series.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the length of the category vector should be equal to the one of the input data series.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the number of data series should be equal to the number of data names.

CombinedLineBarPlot

public CombinedLineBarPlot(java.lang.String[] linePlotDataNames,
                           java.lang.String[] barPlotDataNames,
                           java.lang.String[] category,
                           double[][] linePlotData,
                           double[][] barPlotData)
Creates a new combined line and bar plot with the default title "Combined Line and Bar Plot", x-label "Category", and y-labels "Value". The upper plot is the line plot.

Parameters:
linePlotDataNames - the names of the data series for the line plot,
dataNames[j]: the name of the (j+1)'th data series.
barPlotDataNames - the names of the data series for the bar plot,
dataNames[j]: the name of the (j+1)'th data series.
category - the categories the data belong to,
category[j]: the (j+1)'th category.
linePlotData - the data series for the line plot,
data[j]: the (j+1)'th data series.
barPlotData - the data series for the bar plot,
data[j]: the (j+1)'th data series.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the length of the category vector should be equal to the one of the input data series.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the number of data series should be equal to the number of data names.
